description: nixpkgs.dockerTools provides programmatic container building with no Docker daemon required, unlike Dockerfiles
Nix builds single-layer images by default, with Redis at 42MB vs 177MB Docker Hub equivalent - 76% size reduction
Nix provides guaranteed reproducibility through content-addressed store, eliminating non-deterministic layer caching issues
dockerTools produces OCI-compliant Docker images that work with Docker, Podman, containerd, and nerdctl
Podman supported on NixOS via virtualisation.podman.enable with dockerCompat alias for drop-in replacement
Nix supports transparent cross-architecture builds via --builders flag: ssh://arm64-builder aarch64-linux
Platform tiers: x86_64-linux (Tier 1, full CI), aarch64-linux (Tier 2, full CI), riscv64-linux (Tier 3, no CI)
Nix binary cache (cache.nixos.org) uses content-addressed storage vs Docker's tag-based registry caching
nix-snapshotter allows containers to directly use /nix/store without copying packages - zero duplication approach
buildLayeredImage enables manual layer grouping for sharing across images - trades simplicity for layer reuse
Arion provides Docker Compose compatibility using Nix modules - virtualisation.arion.projects.*.settings.services
Runtime dependency detection: Nix automatically excludes build-time dependencies (shadow-utils, coreutils) from final image
fakeNss helper provides minimal /etc/passwd and /etc/group for user management without full shadow-utils
Nix images can be larger than Alpine for simple static binaries - Redis example: Alpine 15MB vs Nix 25MB
Flakes enable version-pinned dependencies with flake.lock for reproducible container builds across teams
systemd service management: virtualisation.oci-containers.backend = docker/podman for native service integration
Cachix provides private binary caching for Nix packages including container images - cachix use/push
NVIDIA container toolkit supported: hardware.nvidia-container-toolkit.enable with --device=nvidia.com/gpu=all flag
